usage: Responses should follow the structure presented in this JSON file, within the 'response' field of each response. Each response should therefore contain a 'status', a 'code' and a 'data' property: the property 'status' can be 'success', 'fail' or 'error'; the property 'code' should report the HTTP code sent in the headers; the property 'data' should contain the data of the response.

responses.description: successful response to get request on single object
successful response to get request on objects list
successful response to get request on objects list, with empty list returned
successful response to post request when requester is allowed to receive an identifier for the posted object
successful response to post request when requester is not allowed to receive any identifier for the posted object
successful response to put request on object
successful response to delete request on object
